analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Pairs

original: 8.50. Saṅkilesikaduka🔽Nasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasaṅkilesikaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca naasaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: saṅkilesika duka  na saṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca na saṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na saṅkilesika  dhammam paṭicca na asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na saṅkilesikam dhamma

original: paṭicca nasaṅkilesiko ca naasaṅkilesiko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Naasaṅkilesikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naasaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: paṭicca na saṅkilesiko ca na asaṅkilesiko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  na asaṅkilesikam dhammam paṭicca na asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a corrupted phenomenon as condition, a corrupted phenomenon arises, a homogeneous cause condition. With a corrupted phenomenon as condition, an uncorrupted phenomenon arises, a homogeneous cause condition. With a corrupted phenomenon as condition, a corrupted and an uncorrupted phenomenon arise, a homogeneous cause condition.🔽With an uncorrupted phenomenon as condition, an uncorrupted phenomenon arises, a homogeneous cause condition.

original: Nasaṅkilesikañca naasaṅkilesikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naasaṅkilesiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na saṅkilesikam ca na asaṅkilesikam ca dhammam paṭicca na asaṅkilesikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a corrupted and an uncorrupted phenomenon as condition, an uncorrupted phenomenon arises, a homogeneous cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate pañca. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe avigate pañca sabbattha vitthāro
translated: In the section on root cause, there are five; in the section on object, there are two; … in the section on non-hindrance, there are five. (In all sections, the explanation is in brief.)
